text.section: In this section, "Fund" means the Housing Counseling and Foreclosure Mediation Fund.
There is a Housing Counseling and Foreclosure Mediation Fund.

The purposes of the Fund are to:
support nonprofit and government housing counselors and other nonprofit entities with providing:
legal assistance to homeowners or occupants who are trying to avoid foreclosure or manage foreclosure proceedings; and
homebuyer education, housing advice, or financial counseling for homeowners and prospective homeowners;
support the establishment and operation of nonprofit housing counseling entities;
support efforts by the Department and the Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation to:
contact and provide advice and assistance to homeowners or occupants facing financial difficulty or foreclosure; and
provide advice and assistance to prospective homeowners; and
assist in funding the costs of foreclosure mediations provided by the Office of Administrative Hearings under § 7-105.1 of the Real Property Article.
The Department shall administer the Fund.

section.section: The Fund is a special, nonlapsing fund that is not subject to § 7-302 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.
The State Treasurer shall hold the Fund separately, and the Comptroller shall account for the Fund.

text.section: The Fund may be used only for the purposes described in subsection (c) of this section.

section.section: The State Treasurer shall invest the money of the Fund in the same manner as other State money may be invested.
Any investment earnings of the Fund shall be paid into the Fund.

text.section: Expenditures from the Fund may be made only in accordance with the State budget.
